intro: Erigeron popovii, commonly known as the Siberian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, gray-green leaves. Its flowers bloom in shades of white to pale blue, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron popovii is often found in alpine and steppe regions, where it thrives in cooler, arid conditions.
